text: Hi Everybody. I am using a `hubdbrow` field in my module definition. The corresponding HubDB table contains a multivalue-select `products`. How can I display the values of the field `products` in the module settings in the website designer? Currently, it only displays a “blank” space for this column.
Does anyone know how to use a navigation menu in local dev tools? Or that could point me to somewhere I could read about this?
Are you referring to the tag? What are you trying to do?

Yea, that was what I meant to accomplish. I already managed to create a custom menu at the editor and then invoke it through the tag using its name. I’m new to HubSpot so it has been complicated. Right now I’m trying to style the header locally but can’t manage to do that. And all of the resources that I find are based on the online editor.

Hey all - this might be a really dumb question but I'm having issues with dnd_module widths - specifically, they seem to ignore the width i put in and resize automatically, and I dont have a draggable resize bar showing up when using a section? Am I missing something?

Hi there, I'm looking to build a mega menu in my nav and not sure how to go about it. I tried to Google it but it didn't really help. Has anyone built a mega menu before in HubSpot? Also, I had an idea but wasn't sure if it was doable -  is it possible to create a module that can be used as a submenu/part of a mega menu?

Any help is appreciated.
